rows.ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA — GO / NO-GO GATE: What must be true before the first PM Co-Founder touches a tab. This is Week 0. Nothing starts until this clears.
Before anyone starts production, there is a calibration session.
Claude gets prompted with a P-tab and produces a sample C-tab. You or the Steward grades that output against the rubric.
The test is NOT whether Claude can write. We know it can.
The test is whether the P-tab spec is clear enough that Claude + any competent PM produces B-grade output on first pass.
If Claude misses, the P-tab is underspecified. That's the diagnostic. Fix the P-tab, not Claude.
If it takes two rounds of P-tab revision on M0, fine. Better to find out in Week 0 than Week 4.
The acceptance criteria is: "P-tabs are specified well enough that Claude + any competent PM produces B-grade output on first pass."
This is the single most important gate in the entire production. If this fails, nothing else matters.

rows.col_2: Action
Select 2-3 P-tabs from M0 thesis cluster (non-critical TUPs)
rows.col_4: P-tabs exist with scope, win conditions, tab list, dependencies
rows.col_5: Write P-tabs. Cannot proceed without them.

rows.col_2: Prompt Claude with P-tab spec. No additional context beyond what the P-tab contains.
rows.col_5: If Claude produces garbage: P-tab is underspecified. Revise and repeat.

rows.col_2: Grade Claude's output against Grading System rubric. Apply ACP criteria as if you were the Expert Reviewer.
rows.col_4: Output scores B or above on first pass. Minor edits needed, not major rewrites.
rows.col_5: If C or below: identify what's missing from the P-tab spec. Add it. Repeat from Step 2.

rows.col_2: Have a DIFFERENT person (not Nilo) prompt Claude with the same P-tab. No coaching.
rows.col_4: Same person + Claude produces comparable B-grade output. Not person-dependent.
rows.col_5: If output quality drops: the P-tab relies on context in Nilo's head that isn't written down. Extract and add to P-tab.

rows.col_2: Document the calibration results. Record: which P-tabs tested, grades assigned, revisions needed, final pass/fail.
rows.col_4: Written record exists. Lessons applied to remaining P-tabs.
rows.col_5: N/A — this step always passes if you do it.

rows.col_2: Apply lessons to ALL P-tabs across all clusters. If M0 P-tabs needed revision, assume others do too.
rows.col_4: All P-tabs revised to calibrated standard. Spot-check 2-3 from other clusters.
rows.col_5: If widespread P-tab issues: extend Week 0. Do not start production with underspecified P-tabs.

rows.ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA — GO / NO-GO GATE: Every item must be GREEN before Week 1 production begins.

rows.col_2: Acceptance Criterion
rows.col_6: Bottleneck If Not Met

rows.col_2: M0 thesis locked or near-locked. Core ICP, positioning, kill criteria committed.
rows.col_6: NILO — M0 is Nilo + Claude. Nobody else can do this.

rows.col_2: P-tabs for first 2-3 clusters written and Claude-tested (calibration protocol passed).
rows.col_6: NILO — P-tabs encode Nilo's thesis. Cannot be delegated until M0 is locked.

rows.col_4: Conductor confirms hire + Nilo confirms orientation
rows.col_6: CONDUCTOR — sourcing the Librarian is Conductor's first task.

rows.col_6: CONDUCTOR — if Conductor isn't hired yet, Nilo is bottleneck for hiring Conductor.

rows.col_2: Google personal accounts + free Notion for Drive structure. Mirrors Trade organization. Free tier tools only.

rows.col_6: NILO — 30-minute task. Just do it.

rows.col_2: PM and Expert Advisor agreement templates drafted using Claude. Lawyer review later when funded ($500-1K).
rows.col_6: NILO + LAWYER — can parallel-track with AC-05.

rows.col_2: Steward audit complete. 10-point structural check on Trade passes.
rows.col_6: STEWARD — needs to be hired/assigned. Caio or equivalent.

rows.col_2: Communication tool set up. Free Slack tier or Discord. Channel structure defined.
rows.col_6: Low bottleneck — 1-hour task.

rows.col_2: Role Registry reviewed by Steward. No orphaned aliases in active tabs.
rows.col_6: Blocked by AC-10 (Steward audit).

rows.col_2: One calibration sprint completed on non-critical cluster. 80/20 model validated.
rows.col_6: NILO — this IS the Claude calibration test. Most important gate.

rows.col_2: MC identified or pipeline active. Role is ~10-12 hrs/week (compatible with full-time job). 10% equity.
rows.col_6: CONDUCTOR — MC hire can happen Week 1-2, but sourcing starts Week 0.

rows.col_2: Bank account opened (Mercury free tier or similar). Needs EIN from AC-05.
rows.col_6: Blocked by AC-05 (entity + EIN).

rows.ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA — GO / NO-GO GATE: Phase 1 bottleneck: NILO. M0 thesis, P-tabs, legal entity, cap table template. Nobody else can do these. This is the founder tax.
Phase 2 bottleneck: CONDUCTOR. Hiring Librarian, building PM pipeline, sourcing MC candidates. If Conductor isn't hired, Nilo is bottleneck for hiring Conductor.
Phase 3 bottleneck: LIBRARIAN. Organizing Drive, distributing tab slices, tracking status. Steady-state production depends on Librarian routing speed.
The sequence is: Nilo unblocks → Conductor sources → Librarian routes → Production flows.
If you're stuck at any point, ask: "who is the current bottleneck?" and unblock that person.
NILO'S ROLE DURING PRODUCTION (after Week 0 clears)
After M0 locks and acceptance criteria clear, Nilo goes on-call. Genuinely hands-off.
Two exceptions: (1) On-call for thesis questions from PMs. (2) Final sign-off authority on V-tabs (can delegate to expert grade).
The protocol replaces the CEO function during imagination. That is the entire claim of the research paper.
If Nilo ends up being more active in practice, LOG IT. That's data for Paper 2.
"Founder involvement was higher/lower than protocol predicted" is a finding, not a failure.
A proper CEO (CoS/Operator) activates post-funding. Week 8-12 earliest. The protocol holds until then.
